definition: book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership

sentences.english: I came from Soochow, I am a little servant in Wah's family.
sentences.chinese: 我原籍苏州，现任华府伴读小书僮。

sentences.english: He comes from Boula, wherever that may be, ie and I don't know where that is.
sentences.chinese: 他原籍是布拉，也不用管它在什么地方吧。

sentences.english: An ancestral native of Chenghai, Guangdong, Professor Lin Shengyang was a famous modern abstract artist.
sentences.chinese: 林圣扬博士为著名现代抽象艺术家，原籍广东澄海。

sentences.english: Carlos Gardel was born French, but grew up in Argentina.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯加德尔原籍法国，但在阿根廷长大。

sentences.english: Ms. Aragon's parents are from the Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉贡的父母原籍都是菲律宾。

sentences.english: Qian Xiaochun was born in Yuhuan, Zhejiang in 1947.
sentences.chinese: 钱小纯，1947年出生于浙江玉环，原籍杭州。

sentences.english: Qian was the son of a government official, born in the city of Hangzhou in the coastal  province of Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 钱学森原籍浙江杭州，生于官宦之家。

sentences.english: Wei family moved to Dizhou in Shandong province from Zaoqiang in Hebei province at the beginning of Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 惠民魏氏家族原籍河北枣强，明初迁至山东棣州。

definition: one's native place/place of ancestry/registered birthplace
to move (from one residence to another)
to register as domiciled in another land/naturalization
to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
